DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Therapeutic Procedure Code System Data Source Data Value Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes._The person or authoritative body who provided the information._The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A systematized collection of concepts that define corresponding codes._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.
